org.letras.ps.region
Class RegionTreeNode

java.lang.Object
  org.letras.ps.region.RegionTreeNode

public class RegionTreeNode
extends java.lang.Object

A Region in the hierarchy. A Region models a part of the Anoto coordinate space defined by an IShape. Regions can contain sub-regions that are contained within the bounds of their defining IShape. This way a containment hierarchy of bounding boxes is formed. A point intersection test can be performed on any Region in the hierarchy. The test yields the RegionTreeNode with the lowest height (i.e. that is nearest to a leaf or is a leaf itself) that contains the point. This is required for dispatching pen samples to the appropriate RegionTreeNode. For the structure and the geometry of the hierarchy, the following assumptions hold:

  • Any IShape contains (geometrically, not structurally) itself (weak containment is employed).
  • Nodes entirely contain any of their children.
  • Nodes have at most two children (the hierarchy is a binary tree).
  • Siblings do not intersect.
  • The bounding boxes of siblings do not intersect.
  • When adding RegionTreeNodes to the tree, additional virtual RegionTreeNodes may be created.
  • Virtual RegionTreeNodes may be destroyed any time.
  • When adding subtrees, their structure may not be preserved.
A Region has a property defined by a generic type parameter. This can be used to store information relevant to performing the actual dispatch without introducing a dependency from the model to the component doing the dispatching.

Author:
Jannik Jochem

Constructor Detail

RegionTreeNode

public RegionTreeNode(IRegion region)
Create a new Region from shape. The region is non-virtual (it cannot be destroyed or resized).

Parameters:
region - the Region to create the tree node from

RegionTreeNode

public RegionTreeNode(IShape shape,
                      boolean virtual)
Creates a new Region from shape. The region is virtual iff virtual is true. This means that it may be destroyed or resized when rebalancing the hierarchy.

Parameters:
shape -
virtual -
Method Detail

getIntersectingRegion

public RegionTreeNode getIntersectingRegion(double x,
                                            double y)
Determines the lowest Region in the tree that (weakly) contains the point (x,y). If the point is not contained in this region, the request is recursively passed up to the parent region until a region is reached that contains the point.

Parameters:
x -
y -

getIntersectingRegionRecursive

protected RegionTreeNode getIntersectingRegionRecursive(double x,
                                                        double y)
Determines the lowest Region in the tree that contains the point (x,y). Precondition: this Region contains the point (x,y).

Parameters:
x -
y -

getIntersectingRegionInternal

protected RegionTreeNode getIntersectingRegionInternal(double x,
                                                       double y)
Determines the lowest Region in the tree that contains the point (x,y) and is a (transitive) child of this Region. If this Region does not contain the point (x,y), null is returned.

Parameters:
x -
y -
Returns:
the lowest Region in the tree that contains the point (x,y) and is a child of this Region, null if the point is not contained in any child of this Region.

add

public void add(RegionTreeNode child)
Adds a new Region below this Region. If the child's bounds exceed the bounds of this RegionTreeNode, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

Parameters:
child -
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the child's bounds exceed the bounds of this RegionTreeNode

addInternal

protected void addInternal(RegionTreeNode child)
Adds a new Region below this Region. The added child's bounds must be entirely within the bounds of this Region, otherwise unspecified Behavior may occur.

Parameters:
child -

remove

public void remove(RegionTreeNode child)
Removes a node that is somewhere below this node from the containment hierarchy.

Parameters:
child -

generateSubtree

protected RegionTreeNode generateSubtree()
Forms the entire subtree below this node into a new subtree, i.e. merges leftChild and rightChild into a new subtree. This is needed when this node is removed.

Returns:
a node that contains the entire subtree below this node, null iff isLeaf() returns true.

Returns:
